pullRequest.body:
We generalize the universes in `bddAbove_range` by taking in a `Small` hypothesis instead.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

We don't perform this same change in `Ordinal` just yet, as there are a couple more theorems about the supremum that could also be generalized after #15820 goes through.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [6149daaaf5](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16394/commits/6149daaaf578e85310eb7e3e4ae47ca59d4b728b)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ bddAbove_range'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
Should we preserve the old version so avoid `have := `s everywhere?

Ideally we wouldn't even need `have` and this would just be an instance, but the docstring on `small_max` suggests this doesn't work. That said, it surprises me that just writing `have := small_max` without specifying arguments or universes is enough for the instance to be found. Maybe the regression was fixed?

I'll test if adding back the instance works. If not, I'll add back the old version with a prime.
I've started a [Zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/using.20UnivLE/near/468054654) to discuss the best course of action here.
I think I was a bit confused. I'll make the primed lemma in a bit.
I made the old version into a primed lemma. It's a bit unfortunate that this is the more useful version a lot of the time...
Just realized that this lemma can actually be subsumed by `bddAbove_of_small`. Will close this PR and open a new one deprecating it.

pullRequest.title: feat(SetTheory/Cardinal/Basic): generalize universes

### PR summary [6149daaaf5](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16394/commits/6149daaaf578e85310eb7e3e4ae47ca59d4b728b)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ bddAbove_range'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
Should we preserve the old version so avoid `have := `s everywhere?

Ideally we wouldn't even need `have` and this would just be an instance, but the docstring on `small_max` suggests this doesn't work. That said, it surprises me that just writing `have := small_max` without specifying arguments or universes is enough for the instance to be found. Maybe the regression was fixed?

I'll test if adding back the instance works. If not, I'll add back the old version with a prime.
I've started a [Zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/using.20UnivLE/near/468054654) to discuss the best course of action here.
I think I was a bit confused. I'll make the primed lemma in a bit.
I made the old version into a primed lemma. It's a bit unfortunate that this is the more useful version a lot of the time...
Just realized that this lemma can actually be subsumed by `bddAbove_of_small`. Will close this PR and open a new one deprecating it.
